intro: Ophiorrhiza singapurensis, commonly known as the Singapore orchid vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, including Singapore. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, fragrant flowers. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
